intro: Telanthera stellata, commonly known as the star-flowered telanthera, is a herbaceous perennial native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Telanthera stellata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
